data.title: CATCO is Kids Presents Babe, The Sheep Pig March 1-10
data.meta_description: Based on the popular movie, Babe, and the classic children’s book by Dick King-Smith, The Sheep-Pig, comes Babe, The Sheep-Pig, which will be pres…
data.text:
Based on the popular movie, Babe, and the classic children’s book by Dick King-Smith, The Sheep-Pig, comes Babe, The Sheep-Pig, which will be presented by CATCO is Kids March 1-10 and features 21 central Ohio youth actors. Find out below how you can win tickets!

This “tail” of farmyard adventure, accompanied by music, is full of heroes, villains and an adorable piglet, who charms his way to success at the Grand Challenge Sheep Dog Trials, with the help of his sheep-dog friend, Fly.

“Babe, The Sheep-Pig is a timeless tale that guarantees to generate laughs and warm hearts,” said Joe Bishara, CATCO associate producing director.

Written in 1983, The Sheep-Pig was awarded Britain’s Guardian Children’s Fiction Prize and was among more than 100 children’s books written by King-Smith, who was also a farmer for many years. In 1995, the heartwarming story was adapted into a blockbuster movie. It has been adapted for young audiences by David Wood.

All performances will be held in the Van Fleet Theatre, Columbus Performing Arts Center, 549 Franklin Ave. Tickets are $15 for adults, $10 for children. Showtimes for Babe, The Sheep-Pig are Fridays, March 1 and 8, at 7 p.m.; Saturdays, March 2 and 9, at 1 p.m. and 2:30 p.m.; and Sundays, March 3 and 10, at 1 p.m. and 2:30 p.m. Tickets can be purchased HERE

To familiarize children with the play before they attend and enrich their experience afterward, parents can access CATCO is Kids’ play guide for Babe, The Sheep-Pig. The guide can be found at:

http://catco.org/www/dcms/files/pdf/playguides/catcokidsbabeplayguide.pdf

(GIVEAWAY) Enter to Win Four Tickets to see Babe, The Sheep-Pig om 3/2/19 at 1 pm or 3/9/19 at 1pm

REQUIRED ENTRY: Please fill out the google form HERE (required entry). You must be a subscriber of NW Columbus Macaroni Kid's FREE eNewsletter, a weekly resource for local kid and family events. Subscribe today.
